channel.title: How do you
channel.description: I have 1 question i have my source (project Territh) and its kind of laggy with only 15 players online. how do i clear up the server? :confused: i would greatly appreciate a reply. thanks

item.title: How do you
item.dc:creator: @firewithin3 firewithin3
item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

[quote=“Prima, post:13, topic:249557”][quote author=firewithin3 link=topic=328938.msg2572537#msg2572537 date=1228767947]

In ‘public void process()’ add:

System.gc()

[/quote]You added it wrong, it should beSystem.gc();

That’s exactly what I just said.[/quote]You forgot the ; so it wouldn’t work.[quote=“chassy13, post:12, topic:249557”]So it won’t like empty out any java files or something, will it? Never seen this before in my life :|[/quote]No, it just empties unused objects from memory, it doesn’t do anything physical to the files.

Read full topic

[/quote]You added it wrong, it should beSystem.gc();[/quote]

item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

[quote=“Prima, post:2, topic:249557”]In ‘public void process()’ add:

System.gc()[/code][/quote]You added it wrong, it should be[code]System.gc();

Read full topic

item.title: How do you
item.dc:creator: @Prima Prima
item.description:
@Prima wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:9, topic:249557”][quote author=Prima link=topic=328938.msg2572431#msg2572431 date=1228760683]
In ‘public void process()’ add:

System.gc()

[/quote]

What exactly does this do?[/quote]

It runs the garbage collector.

Calling the ‘gc()’ method suggests that the Java Virtual Machine expend effort toward recycling unused objects in order to make the memory they currently occupy available for quick reuse. When control returns from the method call, the Java Virtual Machine has made a best effort to reclaim space from all discarded objects.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you
item.dc:creator: @Prima Prima
item.description:
@Prima wrote:

[quote=“firewithin3, post:7, topic:249557”][quote author=legend-scape link=topic=328938.msg2572468#msg2572468 date=1228764323]

Get a new source such as rs2dv or dodian, get more ram/faster internet connection, fix the several unstability and bad performance problems of wL, etc.

pretty much nooby sources? just remove the per-client then ur source will not lagg
[/quote]Removing thread-per-client is harder to do than you think, you don’t just “remove” it, you have to fix a lot of things up (from what I’ve heard anyways) like loading, saving, banking, etc. How are those sources “nooby”? Just because they’re the most stable ones and best coded?[/quote]

It’s because they have literally have nothing in them, that He thinks that they are “Nooby”. He just can’t program anything into it.

Read full topic
